intro: Macaranga vulcanica, commonly known as the volcanic macaranga, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its alternate, simple leaves with prominent veins. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, often surrounded by bracts. The species is adapted to disturbed habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
